\documentclass[11pt]{article}
\usepackage[a4paper,margin=1in]{geometry}
\usepackage{amsmath,amssymb}
\usepackage{hyperref}

\title{A Cross-Domain Spectral Ladder from $E_{\mathrm{coh}}$ and $\varphi$}
\author{Recognition Physics Institute}
\date{\today}

\begin{document}
\maketitle

\begin{abstract}
We define spectral rails $f_n=f_0\,\varphi^{2n}$ with $f_0=E_{\mathrm{coh}}/h$ and
test line-family centroids for ridge clustering on these rails, with an aligned
eight-window coherence diagnostic. No parameters are fit.
\end{abstract}

\section{Rails}
Rails are $f_n=f_0\,\varphi^{2n}$, with $E_{\mathrm{coh}}=\varphi^{-5}\,\mathrm{eV}$ pinned
in RS. Residuals are computed dimensionlessly as $\Delta_n=f_n^{\rm meas}/f_0-\varphi^{2n}$.

\section{Falsifier}
Reject the ladder if centroids fail to ridge near rails or if the eight-window
coherence diagnostic does not show aligned neutrality.

\end{document}
